headline: PG&E Will Upgrade Infrastructure as Part of 5-Year, $73-Billion Investment Plan
summary: California utility PG&E announced a $73-billion capital expenditure plan covering the next five years, with investments targeting infrastructure upgrades to support growing demand for electricity in its territory, particularly from data centers.

raw.headline: PG&E Will Upgrade Infrastructure as Part of 5-Year, $73-Billion Investment Plan
raw.summary: California utility PG&E announced a $73-billion capital expenditure plan covering the next five years, with investments targeting infrastructure upgrades to support growing demand for electricity in its territory, particularly from data centers.

headline: PG&E unveils $73 billion spending plan to meet surging data-center energy demand
summary: The company had said in July it was working to serve 10 gigawatts (GW) of new electricity demand from data center projects over the next ten years.  Power consumption is expected to hit record highs in 2025 and 2026, driven by a surge in demand from data centers due to increased adoption of artificial intelligence, according to the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA).  PG&E Corp has also been blamed for sparking numerous wildfires, including some of California's most deadly, and has been making investments to improve the reliability of its power grid.
